Title: Release of toxic gas
LessonsLearned: Not yet available.&nbsp; Police investigation is still ongoing. &nbsp;<span style="background-color: fuchsia; background-image: none; background-repeat: repeat; background-attachment: scroll; background-position: 0% 0%; -moz-background-size: auto auto; font-size: 10pt; font-family: Arial; -moz-background-clip: -moz-initial; -moz-background-origin: -moz-initial; -moz-background-inline-policy: -moz-initial;"><span style="background-color: rgb(255, 255, 255);"></span></span>

Reasons.ItemDescription: Substances involved: greater than 5% of quantity in Column 3 of Annex I
Injury to persons: >= 1 fatalities, >= 6 hospitalizing injuries etc.
Immediate damage to the environment (according to Annex VI)

ADFireMajors.ItemDescription: pool fire (burning pool of liquid, contained or uncontained)
jet flame (burning jet of fluid from orifice)
flash fire (burning vapour cloud, subsonic flame front)
fireball (burning mass rising in air, often after BLEVE)

ADFireInitiating.ItemDescription: pool fire (burning pool of liquid, contained or uncontained)
jet flame (burning jet of fluid from orifice)
flash fire (burning vapour cloud, subsonic flame front)
fireball (burning mass rising in air, often after BLEVE)

ADExplosionMajors.ItemDescription: rapid phase-transition explosion (rapid change of state)
VCE (vapour cloud explosion; supersonic wave front)

ADExplosionInitiating.ItemDescription: rapid phase-transition explosion (rapid change of state)
VCE (vapour cloud explosion; supersonic wave front)

Installation_Description: Visbreaking unit of a refinery –thermal vacuum conversion process of residues reducing the production of heavy fuel oils<br>

SiteProcessInitiating.ItemDescription: heat exchanger (boiler, refrigerator, heating coils, etc.

SubstanceClassification.ItemDescription: 09 i. DANGEROUS FOR THE ENVIRONMENT - R50
09 ii. DANGEROUS FOR THE ENVIRONMENT - R51,R53

SubstanceClassificationSV3.ItemDescription: H1. ACUTE TOXIC cat. 1
H2. ACUTE TOXIC  cat. 2 or 3 (n. 7)
H3. STOT SPECIFIC TARGET ORGAN TOXICITY
P1a. EXPLOSIVES, unastable or div. 1.1,1.2,1.3,1.5,1.6 or method A.14 (n. 8)
P1b. EXPLOSIVES div 1.4 (n. 8 and 10)
P2. FLAMMABLE GASES cat. 1 or 2
P3a. FLAMMABLE AEROSOLS (n. 11.1) cat. 1 or 2 w flammable gases or liquids
P3b. FLAMMABLE AEROSOLS (n. 11.1)  cat. 1 or 2 w/o flammable gases or liquids
P4. OXIDISING GASES
P5a. FLAMMABLE LIQUIDS cat. 1, or 2/3 above boiling point (n. 12)
P5b. FLAMMABLE LIQUIDS  cat. 2 or 3  creating hazard conditions (n. 12)
P5c. FLAMMABLE LIQUIDS cat. 2 or 3 not covered by P5a and P5b
P6a. SELF-REACTIVE SUBSTANCES/MIXTURES and ORGANIC PEROXIDES A, B
P6b. SELF-REACTIVE SUBSTANCES/MIXTURES and ORGANIC PEROXIDES C, D, E, F
P7. PYROPHORIC LIQUIDS AND SOLIDS
P8. OXIDISING LIQUIDS AND SOLIDS
E1. Hazardous to the Aquatic Environment cat. Acute 1 or Chronic 1
E2. Hazardous to the Aquatic Environment cat. Chronic 2
O1. Substances/mixtures w hazard statement EUH014
O2. Substances/mixtures emitting flammable gases with water
O3. Substances/mixtures w hazard statement EUH029
00. NAMED SUBSTANCE
No substances

Causes_Description: The victim had to perform an intervention on equipment which could potentially contain H2S. An autopsy has been performed and a judicial investigation started.<span style="background-color: fuchsia; background-image: none; background-repeat: repeat; background-attachment: scroll; background-position: 0% 0%; -moz-background-size: auto auto; font-size: 10pt; font-family: Arial; -moz-background-clip: -moz-initial; -moz-background-origin: -moz-initial; -moz-background-inline-policy: -moz-initial;"><span style="background-color: rgb(255, 255, 255);"></span></span>

CausesHumans.ItemDescription: operator health (includes ailments, intoxication, death, etc.)
wilful disobedience/failure to carry out duties

CausesExternals.ItemDescription: utilities failure (electricity, gas, water, steam air, etc.)

Consequence_Description: The employee was found unconscious by 11:15 hrs and died during the night.<br>
